Posts.Title: Hello Everyone - Kind of Scared skbennett Angelcapp

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2007 02:59PM karenll wrote: Hey katie girl - you will be fine. This will be my 3rd. had 2 bilaterally @ 7 yrs ago, with no problema. We have something in common - this Friday I too will have at it again, this time rt breast only. I'm in New Mexico, the're gonna cut around the nipple, do the needle loc into my tumor, then it's off to surgery. I start at 8:30am and the surgery w/b at 1pm NM time. I will be thinking of you and sending good thoughts your way. Pls, let us know how it goes for you on Fri. Hugs, Karen

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2007 09:41PM karenll wrote: hi liz - Good luck on the 11th. Will be thinkin' of you. Hopefully you won't be "hanging" out too long! Your surgery s/b hopefully, 2- 3 hours. I've had two and no pain (of course sore after)Dr. told me that i would be up and running in no time, for this 3rd one. Hope the same for you. Keep us posted and remember to breathe. Good thoughts & prayers your way. Karen

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2007 12:22AM karenll wrote: hey kat, check out the this site- it has some info that might answer your questions @ discharge. I've had it before they knew what it was, for @30yrs. Basically, you want to get it chk'd out. the color seems to be okay, but better if bilaterally. keep in mind that most all is B9. or it could be infection. But it is good that you are following thru. Be persistant. get your questions answered. You are your own best advocate- & that is key. Pls remember what stress does to our bodies (BAD, BAD, BAD) and take a few deep breathes and just breathe...... Keep us up to date. We are here for you. Hugs, Karen
